brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this prospective non-randomized study was to assess the efficacy and safety of
      endomyocardial botulinum toxin injection in left ventricle for preventing ventricular
      arrhythmias.

clinical_study.brief_title: Botulinum Toxin Injection to Prevent Ventricular Arrhythmias

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  symptomatic ventricular arrhythmias

          -  drug-resistance

          -  unsuccessful one or more ablation procedure with future unreasonable tries

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Previous heart surgery and AF ablation procedure

          -  Emergency CABG

          -  Unstable angina or heart failure

          -  Use antiarrhythmic drugs within 5 elimination half-lives of the drug (or within 2
             months for amiodarone)

          -  Requiring concomitant valve surgery

          -  Left ventricle ejection fraction <35%

          -  Unwillingness to participate
